forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. West wind around 12 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 4am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 49, with temperatures rising to around 51 overnight. Southwest wind 5 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the evening descends upon Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere is thick with the promise of both cloud and chill. The city, partially basking in the fading sunlight, finds itself at a genteel high of approximately 60 degrees, softened by a pleasantly mild west wind. Yet soon, the warmth of the day will yield to the encroaching coolness of night, temperatures dipping toward the upper 40s. A subtle hint of rain is anticipated, painting the twilight sky with clouds and a gentle foreboding, suggesting we might feel the soft brush of raindrops as they begin their descent after the early hours of dawn.

The clarity of the day has waned, with hints of fog lurking in the spaces where the ocean meets the bay, a reminder of those mystic marine layers that often blanket the city. As the evening wears on, it will be wise to dress in layers; a cozy jacket will fend off the cool breezes that dance through the streets. Perhaps consider the low-key allure of curling up at your favorite café with a warm drink, or meandering through the lively streets, where the golden glow of street lamps illuminates the pathways and the sound of conversation drifts into the night air. As darkness deepens, the forecast gently nudges us toward a quiet evening, underscored by the promise of tomorrow’s rain, inviting reflection and warmth.
